isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - VIBRATION DAMPER, CRANKSHAFT, MAIN BEARINGS, FLYWHEEL AND CRANKCASE - FLYWHEEL - FLYWHEEL RESURFACING

step1.para: Flywheels used with manual transmissions may be resurfaced to correct minor wear and scoring.

caution.para: THIS FLYWHEEL RESURFACING INFORMATION IS PROVIDED FOR GUIDANCE ONLY. NAVISTAR INTERNATIONAL CORPORATION ASSUMES NO RESPONSIBILITY EITHER FOR THE RESULTS OF ANY WORK PERFORMED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS INFORMATION OR FOR THE ABILITY OF SERVICE PERSONNEL TO DETECT HEAT CRACKS. ANY CRACK OR HEAT CHECK IN THE FLYWHEEL COULD CAUSE IT TO SEPARATE, CREATING THE POSSIBILITY OF INJURY TO THE OPERATOR OR BYSTANDERS. CAREFULLY EXAMINE THE FLYWHEEL, AFTER RESURFACING, FOR ANY CRACKS OR HEAT CHECKS. IF THERE IS ANY QUESTION, DO NOT USE THE FLYWHEEL.

step1.para:
When resurfacing the flywheel, refer to dimension "A" ( Figure 7.21
), to determine if the flywheel was previously refaced or it if has adequate stock for refacing.

note.para: If the dimensions depicted in Figure 7.21 cannot be maintained, the flywheel must be replaced.

important.para: FLYWHEELS USED WITH AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSIONS CANNOT BE RESURFACED IF DAMAGED. REPLACE FLYWHEEL.
